February 2009 edition:
New Customers and New Upgrades
We are pleased to welcome several new members to the IntApp community and acknowledge existing customers who have acquired additional IntApp products or licenses.
Integration Builder: Blake, Cassels & Graydon LLP Crowell & Moring LLP Downs Rachlin Martin PLLC Kirkland & Ellis LLP
Risk -- Wall Builder/ADAM: Blake, Cassels & Graydon LLP Fox Rothschild LLP Kirkland & Ellis LLP Troutman Sanders LLP Woodcock Washburn LLP

Happy New Year
The team at IntApp would like to take a moment to thank our customers and partners for their enthusiasm and support throughout 2008. We hope everyone had a happy holiday season and we wish everyone the best in 2009.
IntApp Going Virtual
Last year at ILTA, we announced the virtualization of our entire product line. Several firms have already migrated from hardware to pure-software, or are in the process of doing so. "The process of getting virtualized with IntApp was extremely easy," said Adam Klein at Loeb & Loeb.
There are several advantages to going virtual and IntApp stands ready to help. If you would like more information, please contact Neal Vora at Neal.Vora@intapp.com.
Virtualizing Firms: Cadwalader, Wickersham & Taft LLP Hogan & Hartson LLP Lawrence Graham LLP Loeb & Loeb LLP Manatt, Phelps & Phillips, LLP Morrison & Foerster LLP Patterson Belknap Webb & Tyler LLP Sonnenschein Nath & Rosenthal LLP Stikeman Elliott LLP Young Conaway Stargatt & Taylor, LLP
2008 National Law Journal 250 Released
The results of the 2008 NLJ 250, the National Law Journal's 31st annual survey of the nation's largest law firms, were recently published. At present, IntApp counts 35% of the list as clients, including 60% of the top 20.
Further details about rankings and industry trends can be found at: www.law.com.
Announcing Wall Builder 3.4.1
IntApp is pleased to announce the newest release of Wall Builder. With this update we’re announcing a new security module designed specifically to manage contract attorneys. Designated contractors can only see the matters they’re assigned to and no other information in the DMS. Other enhancements include:
Self-maintaining capability for Carpe Diem
Extended compatibility with Handshake, XM Law and Recommind
Interface and ease-of-use improvements
IntApp partners with EIM International
EIM International, a leading provider of information and document management software and services, has signed on as an authorized reseller of IntApp Wall Builder. EIM provides mission-critical services and technology solutions to customers in all areas of document and knowledge management, from initial planning through final implementation, to streamline business processes and increase efficiency. EIM is well-known and highly acclaimed throughout the ECM software community.
Through the partnership, EIM International will offer Wall Builder software and implementation services to its law firm clients.
For more information about EIM International, visit www.eimintl.com.
IntApp nominated for Legal Technology Awards
We are pleased to announce that IntApp has been recognized as a finalist and received high commendations in the fourth annual Legal Technology Awards for the awards: "Technology innovation of the year" and "Best of breed system of the year."
The awards are sponsored by Legalease, publisher of Legal Technology Journal, Legal Business and the Legal 500 series.
The Legal Technology Awards, in association with the Legal Technology Journal, recognize and celebrate excellence in the provision and implementation of technology solutions for the benefit of legal practice.
For more information on the Legal Technology Awards, visit www.legaltechnologyawards.co.uk, and to learn more about the Legal Technology Journal, visit their website at www.legaltechnologyjournal.co.uk.

On March 6, ILTA will be sponsoring an IntApp webinar about integrated information architecture. We will be providing more details in the coming weeks. If you would like to make sure you get an invitation, please email Lea Simon at Lea.Simon@intapp.com.
IntApp Published in ILTA Quarterly Magazine
IntApp was asked to provide two articles for ILTA's November 2008 issue of their magazine, Peer to Peer. The issue focused on risk management, and IntApp provided articles on the subjects of trends in risk management and data leakage. The magazine can be found at http://www.iltanet.org/communications/newsletter.aspx?nvID=000000010805&snvID=000000010805.
